A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie was absolutely awful. You know what was/would be a better movie than this? The trailers. Or just listening to the movie score set to a few of the more interesting scenes without dialog. 

Like most other people here\, I'm first and foremost disappointed with the shoddy script\, which is riddled with plot holes\, forced humor\, and shallow side and main characters that fizzle and go nowhere.  I guess I'm not even sure what the point was? Oh\, wait\, special effects\, punctuated with dialog\, manipulating my nostalgia\, and selling merchandise.

Alyssa Rosenberg's opinion piece in the Washington Post sums it up better than I can: "How to tell if you're going to like 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi'".
